title: Cineflix.Crash.of.the.Century.PDTV.720p.x264.AAC
description:
Crash of the Century

Aired October 28th 2006, Narrated by Mark Halliley.

A Canadian documentary television program produced by Cineflix investigating the Tennerife Airport disaster. "Crash of the Century" explores the tragic collision that occurred between two fully loaded airliners when a blanket of fog affected visibility with devastating consequences.
On the afternoon of 27 March 1977, KLM Flight 4805, a Boeing 747-206B and Pan Am Flight 1736, a Boeing 747-121, (actually the first 747 ever delivered to an airline) collided on the runway at Los Rodeos Airport in Tenerife. Both flights had been diverted to the airfield in Tenerife due to a bomb explosion at their destination airport. (Gran Canaria International Airport) When the KLM 747 began to take off, Pan Am 1736 was still taxiing down the runway. Despite a valient attempt by the Pan Am pilots to turn off the runway, It was too late. The KLM pilots tried to lift their aircraft over the Pan Am, but they didn't have enough speed. The KLM 747 struck the Pan Am 747 killing 583 of the 644 people on board the two aircraft. (the only survivors were from the Pan Am) Prepare to venture into the cockpits and cabins of the two doomed planes as we reconstruct the moments leading up to the tragedy.
